step.context: %text What is the cofactor of $a_{12}$ in % \left\vert\begin{array}{rrr}2 & {\bf -3} & 5 \\ 6 & 0 & 4 \\ 1 & 5 & -7\end{array}\right\vert? \\
%text $\underline{\text{Bonus Question}}$: If in a determinant $A$, a row (or column) is multiplied by its corresponding co-factors, what is the result? %
step.reason:
\text{If }A=\left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} a_1 & a_2 & a_3 \\ b_1 & b_2 & b_3 \\ c_1 & c_2 & c_3 \end{array}\right\vert \\ %text then $|A|=a_1 CF(a_1)+a_2 CF(a_2)+a_3 CF(a_3)$ where $CF(a_n)$ indicates co-factor $a_n$.
If however, a row (or column) is multiplied by the co-factors of a different row, the result is zero. For e.g., % \begin{align} &a_1CF(b_1)+a_2CF(b_2)+a_3CF(b_3) \\ &={\small -a_1(a_2c_3-a_3c_2)+a_2(a_1c_3-a_3c_1)-a_3(a_1c_2-c_1a_2)} \\ &=0 \end{align}
